meanings.definition: The amount of passengers that a bus can carry.
meanings.sent1: The busload of people squeezed into the crowded bus.
meanings.sent2: The busload of tourists arrived at the museum.
meanings.sent3: The busload of clowns made the passengers laugh with their antics.
meanings.sent4: She had a busload of worries on her mind.
meanings.sent5: The busload of students spilled out of the bus, eager for their field trip.

meanings.definition: The group of passengers traveling on a bus.
meanings.sent1: The busload of commuters chatted quietly during the ride.
meanings.sent2: The busload of children sang songs on their way to the zoo.
meanings.sent3: The busload of seniors shared stories and memories on their journey.
meanings.sent4: She felt like a busload of emotions as she waved goodbye.
meanings.sent5: The busload of friends embarked on a road trip adventure together.
